content.raw:
Hi,

I don't know if it is really an error on compilation or on my side. But I was using gazebo on branch Ardupilot (I assume gazebo 7 ? ) and yesterday, I merged default (I assume gazebo 9? )
After correcting libignition changes, the compilation works fine but gazebo was unable to launch... Gzserver was working but gzclient crash with a segfault on " Bad permissions for mapped region at address libQtGui.so" .
I got libqt4-dev installed on my computer... after remove it and install qtbase5-dev, the problem was solved .
So I think that gazebo compilation is still looking for Qt4 instead of Qt5 what can lead to problem is case both are installed or Qt4 is present like in my case
content.html:
Hi,

I don't know if it is really an error on compilation or on my side. But I was using gazebo on branch Ardupilot (I assume gazebo 7 ? ) and yesterday, I merged default (I assume gazebo 9? ) After correcting libignition changes, the compilation works fine but gazebo was unable to launch... Gzserver was working but gzclient crash with a segfault on " Bad permissions for mapped region at address libQtGui.so" . I got libqt4-dev installed on my computer... after remove it and install qtbase5-dev, the problem was solved . So I think that gazebo compilation is still looking for Qt4 instead of Qt5 what can lead to problem is case both are installed or Qt4 is present like in my case
